subject: Business
title: Dollar-Cost Averaging
description: Learn Dollar-Cost Averaging in one minute.

hook.text: You invest $500 monthly regardless of market price. Some months you buy high, some low.

buildup.text: Dollar-cost averaging means investing a fixed amount at regular intervals, ignoring market timing entirely.

discovery.text: When prices drop, your fixed amount buys more shares. When prices rise, it buys fewer. Volatility works for you.

climax.text: The best investment plan is one you actually follow. DCA's simplicity keeps people investing through every market cycle.

punchline.text: Don't time the market. Time in the market wins.

quiz.question: What is the main behavioral advantage of dollar-cost averaging?
options: It removes the fear and hesitation that stops people from investing
